A case-control study was conducted, from September 2002 to June 2003, to identify risk This study was based on data resulted from the National Campaign against Animal Brucellosis in 1996 provided by Comité Estatal para el Fomento y Protección Pecuaria del Estado de Yucatán. The sample size was 156 ranches (78 cases and 78 controls). The cases were ranches with at least one seropositive mature bovine to were with seronegative mature bovines to card seronegative mature bovines confirmed by factors, a questionnaire was applied to the cattle management ranch biosecurity. To establish the association between risk factors and cases an univariable analysis was used and variable...
